sub_topic: Determining the type of bond between two atoms
message_1: What type of bond will be formed between a sodium atom and a chlorine atom, and what is its bond energy?
message_2:
A sodium atom (Na) and a chlorine atom (Cl) will form an ionic bond. Sodium, being a metal, will lose one electron to achieve a stable electron configuration, while chlorine, being a non-metal, will gain one electron to achieve a stable electron configuration. This transfer of electrons results in the formation of a positively charged sodium ion (Na+) and a negatively charged chloride ion (Cl-). The electrostatic attraction between these oppositely charged ions forms the ionic bond.

The bond energy, also known as lattice energy, for sodium chloride (NaCl) is approximately 787 kJ/mol. This is the energy required to separate one mole of solid NaCl into its gaseous ions.
